**Insurance Claims**

# Insurance Claim Lawyer in Conroe

## Dedicated to Helping Accident Victims Get Their Fair Share

After a car accident or other life-disrupting event, medical bills and other
expenses can really add up. Although you may be fully insured, it’s a sad fact
that many of the popular big-name insurance companies are more interested in
increasing shareholder profits than they are in paying out on legitimate
insurance claims for loyal policyholders.

For many of us, the time after an accident or other loss can be stressful and
unsettling enough. Having to find your insurance company less-than-helpful
when you need them the most will add further unnecessary stress.

Whether you’ve been denied coverage for a so-called “exclusion” or your
insurance company isn’t willing to honor coverage that you’ve faithfully paid
for, it’s a good idea to speak with a Conroe insurance claim attorney about
your case.

The only way to make sure your insurance company is acting in good faith is to
have an insurance claim attorney review your actual policy.

**Contact Scott Law Firm today to begin with a free consultation. We can
review your policy and help you seek a fair payout.**

### Auto Policies & Car Accident Claims

Car accidents can leave victims in the hospital and out of work for extended
periods of time. Although we like to hope that our insurance adjusters are
quick to rush in and give us the compensation we deserve, it can take weeks,
months, or longer for some policies to payout.

In the meantime, hospital bills are piling up, family members are missing
work, and there’s no telling how long it will be until you’re back on your
feet. If insurance companies act in bad faith by delaying or denying claims,
it’s a good idea to have a lawyer review your policy and make sure you’re
getting treated fairly.

### Homeowners' Claims

Many well-known homeowner’s insurance companies are notorious for denying
coverage on righteous claims. Whether you’re recovering from storm damage or
the faulty work of a contractor, you should be given the coverage promised in
your homeowner's insurance policy.

Wrongful denial of benefits from a roof claim or some other type of storm or
fire damage can seriously delay your ability to safely live in your home and
get on with your life. A lawyer can review your entire policy and make sure
the insurance company is acting in good faith and lives up to all coverage
promises made in the policy.

### Life Insurance Claims

Losing a loved one, no matter what the circumstances, is a traumatic event for
families. The one thing you should be able to count on is your life insurance
company coming through on the policy.

When insurance companies try to claim an exclusion in coverage after the death
of a loved one, get in touch with an insurance claim attorney immediately.

### Is Your Insurance Company Going to Take Care of You?

Many Americans think that because they pay their insurance premiums, insurance
companies will be helpful and be there for them when they need them.
Unfortunately, that isn’t always the case. In fact, many popular big-name
insurance companies have documented histories of denying and delaying claims.

Insurance companies often deny and delay claims in an effort to get out of
paying out policies. Many of these companies are more interested in their
bottom line than paying out on legitimate claims.

The American Association for Justice (AAJ) completed a comprehensive and
exhaustive investigation that included thousands of court documents, SEC and
FBI records, complaint reports and testimony and depositions from former
insurance adjusters from around the nation to find and rate the worst
insurance companies in the U.S. This study found that some of the worst were
Allstate and AIG, among others.

### When to Call an Insurance Claim Attorney in Conroe, Texas

If you suspect that your insurance company isn’t treating you fairly. Have an
insurance claim attorney in Conroe review your case. Holding insurance
companies accountable for the coverage they’ve promised is essential for
moving forward and getting on with your life.

**At theScott Law Firm, initial consultations are always free. You don’t pay
anything unless we recover compensation for you. Call us at (936) 243-4299 for
a free consultation and case evaluation.**

# Conroe Personal Injury Attorney

## Representing the Injured Throughout Montgomery County

> People who have been injured need an advocate to fight for their rights
> against those who have harmed them. When you file a personal injury claim,
> the insurance companies and their adjusters have one job—to pay you as
> little as possible or even nothing at all.
>
> This can leave you struggling to deal with mounting medical bills, lost
> wages, and the pain and suffering caused by the accident.

Based in Montgomery County, Scott Law Firm represents Texans throughout the
Greater Houston Area, as well as across the state of Texas. If you have been
injured in an accident, our Conroe personal injury lawyers can help.

We provide personalized legal counsel and dedicated representation for victims
of car accidents, truck accidents, uninsured/underinsured motorist claims,
motorcycle accidents, brain injuries, wrongful death, and more. We can help
you understand your legal options and fight to protect your right to a fair
recovery.

> When you or someone you love is injured due to someone else’s negligent or
> wrongful conduct, the most important thing is to make sure you or your loved
> one is receiving the health care needed to heal.
>
> Having an aggressive attorney on your side will help ensure that you are in
> the best possible position to get the care you need.
>
> Dealing with the stress of an insurance claim only adds to the stress of
> trying to recover from a serious injury, but an attorney can help you
> navigate this process and work to ensure that you receive all of the
> financial compensation you are owed for your losses.

> ### How to File a Personal Injury Claim

In short, the process of filing a personal injury claim is:

  * Pick the appropriate court
  * File a complaint to that court
  * Prove negligence in your case
  * If necessary, go to trial

An experienced attorney from our firm can guide you through the entire process
and ensure all evidence is collected and all paperwork is properly submitted
so the only thing you have to worry about is recovering from your injuries.
Interested in learning more about how to file a personal injury claim?

####  Frequently Asked Questions

  * ###  How do I know if I have a personal injury case? 

If you were injured or if someone you love died due to another person,
company, or entity’s negligent or wrongful conduct, you have grounds for a
personal injury (or wrongful death) case. To bring a successful claim, you
will have to prove that another person or party owed you a duty of care,
failed to uphold that duty of care, and therefore caused you injury and
damages. For example, drivers have a duty of care to keep others on the road
safe by following the law and taking reasonable actions to avoid accidents.
When a driver violates this duty of care—by texting while driving or driving
while drunk, for example—and causes an accident, the injured victims can file
claims against the at-fault driver.

  * ###  What are damages? 

Damages are any losses you sustain due to the accident. They can be either
economic or non-economic in nature, and might include things like medical
bills, lost income/wages, disability, pain and suffering, and future care
costs. The exact damages you may be able to recover will depend on the
specifics of your situation. We recommend that you speak to one of our
attorneys during a free, no-obligation consultation to learn more.

  * ###  How much does a personal injury lawyer cost? 

Many people are understandably concerned about the cost of hiring a lawyer.
After all, when you’re already dealing with the financial challenges caused by
the accident, the idea of hiring an attorney and paying for legal services can
seem like an added burden. But when you work with Scott Law Firm, there are no
upfront or out-of-pocket expenses because we provide our services on a
contingency fee basis, meaning we only collect attorneys’ fees if/when we win
your case. If we do not recover a settlement or verdict on your behalf, you do
not pay.

  * ###  Do I really need an attorney to file a personal injury claim? 

While you are not required by law to work with an attorney in filing your
claim, it is strongly recommended that you do. This is because the insurance
company will likely be working actively against you. Their goal is to do
everything they can to dispute, devalue, or deny your claim. If you speak
directly to the insurance adjuster, you might accidentally admit fault,
downplay your injuries and damages, or otherwise compromise your rights. But
by having an experienced attorney on your side, you not only have someone who
will fight back against tricky insurance company tactics, but you can also
focus on what matters most—healing—while your legal team handles the details
of your case. Most people who work with an attorney during their injury claim
receive higher settlements and, in the event the insurance company refuses to
offer a fair settlement, your attorney will be ready to represent you at
trial.

  * ###  Why should I choose Scott Law Firm? 

Navigating the legal process is complex and time-consuming. You want a legal
team that has the experience and reputation needed to effectively represent
you. At Scott Law Firm, we are dedicated to protecting the rights of injured
victims and fighting to secure better futures on their behalf. Our award-
winning team is available to assist you 24/7, and we offer same-day, evening,
and weekend appointments by request. We can also come to you if your injuries
prevent you from traveling to our office. We provide legal services in
English, Spanish, and Korean and are proud to represent clients throughout
Montgomery County and the entire state of Texas. Reach out to us today to
learn how we can help you specifically with your case.
